text: Psalm 84
The Joy of Worshiping in the Temple
For the \add music\add* director; on the Gittith.
Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 84 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
How lovely \add are\add* your dwelling places,
O Yahweh of hosts!
My soul longs and even fails
for the courtyards of Yahweh.
My heart and flesh sing for joy
to the living God.
Even a bird finds a home, and a swallow a nest for herself,
where she may lay her young,
near your altars, O Yahweh \add of\add* hosts,
my king and my God.
Blessed \add are\add* those who dwell in your house;\f + \fr 84:4 \ft Or “temple” \f*
they can ever praise you. \qs Selah\qs*
Blessed \add is the\add* man whose strength \add is\add* in you;
in their heart \add are the\add* highways \add to Zion\add*.
Passing through the Valley of Baca,\f + \fr 84:6 \ft Or “Valley of Weeping” \f*
they make it a spring.
The early rain covers \add it with\add* blessings\f + \fr 84:6 \ft A change in vocalization of the Hebrew yields “\fq it with \ft pools” \f* as well.
They go from strength to strength,
\add until each\add* appears before God in Zion.\f + \fr 84:7 \ft Or “the God of gods will be seen in Zion” \f*
O Yahweh, God of hosts, hear my prayer;
give ear, O God of Jacob. \qs Selah\qs*
Look at our shield, O God,
and have regard for the face of your anointed one.
Because better \add is\add* a day in your courtyards
than a thousand \add elsewhere\add*.
I would rather be at the threshold of the house\f + \fr 84:10 \ft Or “temple” \f* of my God
than to dwell in \add the\add* tents of wickedness.
Because Yahweh God \add is\add* a sun and a shield;
Yahweh gives grace and honor.
He does not withhold good from those who walk blamelessly.
O Yahweh \add of\add* hosts,
blessed \add is the\add* man who trusts you.
